title: Milken-Motsepe Prize offers $2m in prizes for African AI solutions transforming manufacturing
subtitle: Applications are open for the US$2 million Milken-Motsepe Prize, which aims to support African AI solutions transforming manufacturing.
description: TheMilken-Motsepe Prizeis aimed at companies in Africa revolutionising manufacturing value chains in emerging markets by leveraging AI and other emerging technologies. It offers US$2 million in total prizes, including a US$1 million Grand Prize, with participating companies also gaining access to exclusive networking and the opportunity to pitch to industry leaders and key decision-makers. “If your company is using AI and advanced data analytics to boost efficiency, reduce waste, and deliver scalable impact – this is your moment. We’re looking for tech-powered solutions ready to drive job creation, unlock commercial growth, and ignite breakthroughs across the globe,” organisers said. The winning team will demonstrate a scalable innovation across manufacturing value chains that leverages AI to deliver measurable impact in efficiency and waste loss. Teams will be evaluated on commercial viability, technological integration, operational economics, and market scalability in Africa. Applications are openhereuntil July 31.

We’re looking for tech-powered solutions ready to drive job creation, unlock commercial growth, and ignite breakthroughs across the globe,” organisers said.The winning team will demonstrate a scalable innovation across manufacturing value chains that leverages AI to deliver measurable impact in efficiency and waste loss. Teams will be evaluated on commercial viability, technological integration, operational economics, and market scalability in Africa.Applications are openhereuntil July 31.
meta_title: Prix Milken-Motsepe : 2M$ pour l'IA en Afrique
Meta Description: Le prix Milken-Motsepe offre 2 millions de dollars à des solutions d'IA africaines pour transformer la fabrication. Candidatures jusqu'au 31 juillet.

draft_summary.introduction: Le prix Milken-Motsepe, doté de 2 millions de dollars US, est ouvert aux candidatures.  Ce prix vise à soutenir les solutions d'intelligence artificielle (IA) africaines qui transforment le secteur manufacturier.

details.objectif: Le prix soutient les entreprises africaines qui révolutionnent les chaînes de valeur manufacturières sur les marchés émergents en utilisant l'IA et d'autres technologies émergentes.
details.montant: Un grand prix de 1 million de dollars US est offert, ainsi que d'autres prix pour un total de 2 millions de dollars US.
details.avantages_supplémentaires: Les entreprises participantes bénéficieront d'un réseautage exclusif et de l'opportunité de présenter leurs projets à des leaders de l'industrie et des décideurs clés.
details.critères_de_sélection: Les équipes seront évaluées sur la viabilité commerciale, l'intégration technologique, les aspects économiques opérationnels et l'évolutivité du marché en Afrique.  L'innovation doit être évolutive, utiliser l'IA pour améliorer l'efficacité et réduire les pertes.
details.éligibilité: Les entreprises utilisant l'IA et l'analyse de données avancée pour améliorer l'efficacité, réduire les déchets et produire un impact mesurable sont invitées à postuler.

draft_summary.conclusion: La date limite de soumission des candidatures est le 31 juillet.  Ce prix offre une occasion unique aux entreprises africaines innovantes de faire progresser leurs solutions d'IA dans le secteur manufacturier.

title: Africa’s Business Heroes selects top 50 finalists for $1.5m 2025 competition
subtitle: Africa’s Business Heroes (ABH), the flagship philanthropic initiative of the Alibaba Philanthropy, has announced the top 50 finalists for its US$1.5 million 2025 competition – marking a record-breaking year for participation and regional representation.
description: Africa’s Business Heroes (ABH) is the Jack Ma Foundation’s flagship philanthropic initiative in Africa. It supports visionary entrepreneurs across all 54 African countries who are building inclusive and sustainable economies. Over 10 years, ABH will recognise 100 entrepreneurs, awarding them with grant funding, training, and a platform to amplify their stories. Each year, the top 10 finalists compete in a televised pitch finale for a share of US$1.5 million. This year, ABH received 32,000 applications, the highest in the competition’s history, with submissions from all 54 African countries. Fifty startups have been selected as finalists for the seventh edition of the competition. They span 16 sectors and hail from 17 countries, with 36 per cent female representation and 10 per cent Francophone entrepreneurs. As part of the next stage of the competition, the Top 50 will participate in the ABH Virtual Bootcamp, an intensive training program featuring workshops led by ecosystem leaders, investors, and ABH Heroes. Topics will include building resilient teams, investment readiness, leveraging AI, and digital marketing for growth. “The 2025 ABH Prize has raised the bar, yet again. We are seeing greater depth, diversity, and innovation across the span of applications,” said Zahra Baitie-Boateng, managing director for Africa at ABH. “This record-breaking year speaks to the relevance of ABH in every corner of the continent. These 50 finalists are solving real problems with global potential, and we’re excited to amplify their work.” In addition to training and mentorship, the top 50 will benefit from media exposure and access to a dynamic network of ABH Heroes, alumni, and partners. They will then undergo a second round of evaluations through in-depth interviews with ABH round two judges, after which 22 entrepreneurs will be shortlisted to undergo due diligence led by PlusVC. Those who advance will be revealed as the top 20 finalists in August, before heading to Dakar for the semi-finale in September. The top 10 finalists selected in Dakar will then progress to the grand finale in Kigali in December, where they will compete for their share of US$1.5 million in grant funding and be crowned this year’s Africa’s Business Heroes. To learn more about the 2025 ABH Top 50 finalists and the competition, gohere.

title: 3rd Africa Money & DeFi Summit set for Ghana in September
subtitle: The third edition of the Africa Money & DeFi Summit West Africa returns to Accra, Ghana on September 24–25, bringing together over 500 leaders across fintech, Web3, and decentralised finance.
description: TheAfrica Money & DeFi Summit West Africa, curated by the team behind the Africa Tech Summit Series, is a leading tech conference that provides valuable insights and networking opportunities for the pan-African fintech, DeFi) and Web3 ecosystem. Hosted in Accra, Ghana, the event brings together fintech leaders, MNOs, international investors, entrepreneurs, government representatives, trade bodies, media, and leading ventures to drive investment and foster business collaborations within the African Fintech and DeFi ecosystem. “Africa’s financial landscape is evolving rapidly. Stablecoins now support payroll, cross-border transfers, and business operations – driving real commercial momentum. With mobile-based stablecoin transfers up 61 per cent and 43 per cent of digital asset transactions involving stablecoins, adoption is accelerating,” said Andrew Fassnidge, director of Africa Money & DeFi Summit. “Fintech innovation is at the heart of this shift, spanning embedded finance, lending platforms, digital identity, Web3, mobile money, and digital commerce. This summit brings together the builders, investors, and platforms turning emerging technologies into scalable business and investment opportunities.” Applications are now open for theInvestment Showcase, spotlighting investment-ready African ventures across fintech, blockchain, payments, Web3, and DeFi. Selected startups will pitch live to investors and ecosystem leaders, with the potential to secure funding and strategic partnerships.

title: 5th India-Africa Entrepreneurship and Investment Summit set for Nairobi this month
subtitle: The fifth edition of the India-Africa Entrepreneurship and Investment Summit will be held in Nairobi, Kenya, on July 17-18.
description: Hosted by theIndia Africa Business Network (IABN)in collaboration with Kenya Investment Authority, India Kenya Business Council, TiE Africa, and other ecosystem partners, the summit is a premier platform for advancing business partnerships, knowledge exchange, and investment opportunities between India’s US$4 trillion economy and Africa’s US$3.5 trillion frontier markets. The fifth edition of the event will open with a keynote address by Ravi Venkatesan, chair of the Global Energy Alliance for People and Planet, and founder of the Global Alliance for Mass Entrepreneurship. Joining him are prominent business leaders, policymakers, and impact investors, including Raman Roy, chairman and managing director of Quatrro; H.E. Ambassador Philip Thigo, Kenya’s Special Envoy on Technology; and John Mwendwa, CEO of Kenya Investment Authority. “The presence of these eminent leaders signals a deepening commitment to the India–Africa growth corridor,” said Baljinder Sharma, convenor at IABN. “This year’s summit aims to inspire actionable collaboration and build sustainable bridges between two of the world’s most dynamic entrepreneurial regions.”

title: Hedera Africa Hackathon offers $1m cash prize
subtitle: Applications are open for the latest Hedera Africa Hackathon, which challenges applicants to develop blockchain and distributed ledger technology-based scalable solutions tailored to Africa’s most urgent challenges and needs.
description: Powered by the Hashgraph Association, a Swiss non-profit organisation driving global adoption of Hedera-powered solutions by funding innovation, training, certification, and venture building programs, and Exponential Science Foundation, a not-for-profit foundation accelerating responsible tech adoption, via research, education, and innovation activities, the Hedera Africa Hackathon 2025 aims to enable the next-generation of developers and empower economic inclusion in Africa with a digital future for all. The Web3 hackathon initiative combines online participation with onsite events in over 20 African cities, intending to attract over 10,000 participants across more than 15 African countries. Developers, students, and entrepreneurs are invited to collaborate to build decentralized solutions on Hedera across industries such as finance, healthcare, telecoms, sustainability, agriculture, and manufacturing, while leveraging the convergence of other deep technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI), Internet of Things (IoT), Robotics, and Quantum Computing, with a prize pool of more than US$1 million on offer. Applications are openhereuntil September 30.

title: SA’s Woman of Stature Foundation to host entrepreneurship-focused event in July
subtitle: South Africa’s Woman of Stature Foundation will on July 3 host the Professional Collective Summit 2025, an event designed to inspire and equip professional women with the tools they need to thrive and scale their businesses, in Sandton, Johannesburg.
description: TheWoman of Stature Foundation, a registered NPO committed to developing South Africa’s next generation of women entrepreneurs and leaders, hosts its flagshipProfessional Collective Summiteach year, with this year’s event taking place on July 3. Under the theme “Wholeness – The Optimum You”, the one-day summit will unite female entrepreneurs, thought leaders, executives, and changemakers around one shared goal – empowering women to lead holistically, in health, finance, purpose, and enterprise. “With less than 20 per cent of SMEs in SA being female-owned and the failure rate still alarmingly high, initiatives like this are critical to shifting the national economic narrative,” said Charlotte du Plessis, CEO and founder of the Woman of Stature Foundation. “If we want to see real economic transformation in South Africa, we must support women-owned businesses. This summit will offer practical insights, powerful networks, and bold inspiration to make that happen.”

This summit will offer practical insights, powerful networks, and bold inspiration to make that happen.”

title: Winner announced of 3rd edition of annual Africa Impact Investment Awards
subtitle: Krutham, a research-led consulting firm specialising in capital markets and financial services in developing countries, has announced the winners of the third edition of the Africa Impact Investment Awards.
description: Held during the Africa Impact Summit in Accra, Ghana, the 2025 Africa Impact Investment Awards recognised outstanding individuals and organisations whose work exemplifies the principles of intentional, measurable, and scalable impact investing. This year’s winners stood out among a highly competitive field of 64 nominations evaluated by a panel of 11 judges representing leading institutions from across the continent’s impact ecosystem. The 2025 Africa Impact Investment Award Winners Include: “The world cannot be changed without investment,” said Dr Stuart Theobald, executive chairman of Krutham. “These awards shine a light on the pioneers demonstrating that investing in people, planet and purpose can also unlock new paths to financial return. Their work proves that Africa can lead the way in redefining how capital delivers inclusive prosperity.”
content: Krutham, a research-led consulting firm specialising in capital markets and financial services in developing countries, has announced the winners of the third edition of the Africa Impact Investment Awards.Held during the Africa Impact Summit in Accra, Ghana, the 2025 Africa Impact Investment Awards recognised outstanding individuals and organisations whose work exemplifies the principles of intentional, measurable, and scalable impact investing.This year’s winners stood out among a highly competitive field of 64 nominations evaluated by a panel of 11 judges representing leading institutions from across the continent’s impact ecosystem.The 2025 Africa Impact Investment Award Winners Include:Impact Funder of the Year: NithioFor its innovative use of AI and geospatial data to assess credit risk and channel catalytic capital to clean energy SMEs through its FAIR platform.Impact Fund of the Year: KawiSafi VenturesRecognised for exceeding impact targets while reaching 213 million people with clean energy solutions and averting 45 million tonnes of CO₂.Financial Structure of the Year: Acre Impact CapitalFor pioneering the use of export credit agency-backed finance to crowd in private capital for infrastructure projects—mobilising over 5.6x per dollar invested.Impact Intermediary of the Year: Edge GrowthFor delivering customised enterprise and supplier development support to black-owned SMEs in South Africa, with a track record of job creation and sustained business growth.Impact Enterprise of the Year: Cherehani AfricaHonoured for its technology-driven approach to supporting over 30,000 rural women entrepreneurs with access to credit and financial literacy, positively impacting more than 130,000 lives.Trailblazer of the Year: Evelyn CastleCelebrated for her cross-sector leadership in healthcare, impact investing, and gender equity. Evelyn’s ventures have raised over $250 million to date and continue to champion women-led impact enterprises across Africa.Special Judges’ Award: AfriFORTIFIEDAcknowledged for its standout work in food innovation and early-stage support to help SMEs bring nutrient-dense products to market, addressing both malnutrition and market barriers in Kenya’s food economy.“The world cannot be changed without investment,” said Dr Stuart Theobald, executive chairman of Krutham. “These awards shine a light on the pioneers demonstrating that investing in people, planet and purpose can also unlock new paths to financial return. Their work proves that Africa can lead the way in redefining how capital delivers inclusive prosperity.”
meta_title: Africa Impact Investment Awards 2025 Winners Announced
Meta Description: Krutham announces the winners of the 2025 Africa Impact Investment Awards, celebrating outstanding individuals and organizations driving impactful investing across the continent.
draft_summary:
- **Introduction:** The 2025 Africa Impact Investment Awards, hosted by Krutham, celebrated impactful investing across Africa, recognizing outstanding individuals and organizations.  The awards ceremony took place during the Africa Impact Summit in Accra, Ghana.

- **Award Winners:**  The awards highlighted achievements across several categories, including:
    - **Impact Funder of the Year:** Nithio, recognized for using AI and geospatial data to assess credit risk and fund clean energy SMEs.
    - **Impact Fund of the Year:** KawiSafi Ventures, for exceeding impact targets while reaching 213 million people with clean energy solutions.
    - **Financial Structure of the Year:** Acre Impact Capital, for pioneering the use of export credit agency-backed finance to mobilize private capital for infrastructure projects.
    - **Impact Intermediary of the Year:** Edge Growth, for supporting black-owned SMEs in South Africa.
    - **Impact Enterprise of the Year:** Cherehani Africa, for its technology-driven support of rural women entrepreneurs.
    - **Trailblazer of the Year:** Evelyn Castle, for cross-sector leadership in healthcare, impact investing, and gender equity.
    - **Special Judges’ Award:** AfriFORTIFIED, for its work in food innovation in Kenya.

- **Krutham's Perspective:** Dr. Stuart Theobald, executive chairman of Krutham, emphasized the importance of investment in achieving positive impact, highlighting the winners' success in demonstrating that investing in people, planet, and purpose can also unlock financial returns.

- **Conclusion:** The awards underscore Africa's leadership in redefining how capital can deliver inclusive prosperity.  The achievements of the winners showcase the potential of impact investing to address critical challenges and drive sustainable development.
main_image_alt: Winners of the 2025 Africa Impact Investment Awards

title: SA’s Loop named winner at Sentech Africa Tech Week
subtitle: Cape Town-based mobility startup Loop beat six other African tech startups to emerge winner of the pitch competition at the recent Sentech Africa Tech Week.
description: Africa Tech Week is one of the continent’s largest gatherings of technology leaders, innovators, and industry experts, dedicated to showcasing groundbreaking technological solutions driving Africa’s growth. Loop, meanwhile, is changing the game for small businesses and transport providers to enter the digital ecosystem, enabling access to finance and mitigating risks associated with carrying physical cash. The adoption by the market, business profitability and most importantly, the growth and expansion plans through Africa- set Loop apart from the other finalists. The company emerged winner of the pitch competition at Sentech Africa Tech Week, with Loop CEO Imtiyaaz Riley impressing the judging panel with the company’s bold approach to digital payments and mobility in emerging markets. “Our win at Africa Tech Week is more than a trophy – it’s a signal that Africa is ready for real, homegrown innovation,” said Riley. “Loop was built in the heart of Cape Town to solve challenges we’ve lived through. We’re not just digitising payments – we’re rewriting how value moves in communities that have long been excluded. This recognition strengthens our resolve to scale meaningful tech across the continent, unlocking opportunity where it’s needed most.”

title: Mobility startup BuuPass to represent Kenya at global Startup World Cup
subtitle: Kenyan startup BuuPass, East Africa’s leading digital mobility platform, has been selected to represent its country as it participates in the global Startup World Cup for the first time.
description: Founded in 2016 by Sonia Kabra and Wyclife Omondi,BuuPassis a B2B2C mobility marketplace that enables users to search, compare, and book travel tickets via web, app, or USSD, while its SaaS platform helps bus operators manage their operations, inventory, and sales. So far, the startup has sold over 16 million travel tickets and generated over US$100 million in total value of goods sold, while it has also taken part in theGoogle for Startups Accelerator Africaand beenbacked by the Google for Startups Black Founders Fund. For the first time, Kenya has joined the global Startup World Cup circuit, via a partnership between Silicon Xchange, the Kenya National Innovation Agency  (KeNIA), and NaiBAN, and a recent even saw 10 startups pitch live to represent the country. BuuPass was crowned the winner and will represent Kenya at the Startup World Cup grand finale in San Francisco, where it will compete for a US$1 million investment. “We’re honoured to have won the Kenya regional finals of the Startup World Cup. This milestone reflects the passion, grit, and commitment our team has poured into building a seamless transport booking experience for millions across Africa,” said Wyclife Omondi, co-founder of BuuPass. “Representing Kenya at the global finale in San Francisco is both humbling and energising. It’s a powerful moment, not just for BuuPass, but for African innovation as a whole. We look forward to sharing our story, learning from other global startups, and showcasing the potential of Africa-born solutions on one of the biggest entrepreneurial stages in the world.”

title: SA’s Akha Ventures launches Sandton-based venture studio
subtitle: South Africa’s Akha Ventures has announced the launch of its Venture Studio – a dedicated, founder-first ecosystem built to back Africa’s boldest startups.
description: Based in the heart of Sandton, theAkha Studiois a co-working space and a fully-equipped venture building hub designed to take startups from traction to scale – under one roof. Resident founders will get access to private office space and shared infrastructure in the a Sandton office; a 12-month venture-building programme with expert support, strategic guidance, and execution resources; and access to top engineers, marketers, and growth operators. It also includes support with go-to-market, sales systems, and investor readiness; opportunities to pitch to investors, compete on global stages, and access corporate partnerships; and perks from AWS, Stripe, HubSpot, Notion, and others.

title: Applications set to close for Africa Impact Fundraising Grant
subtitle: Applications are set to close for the Africa Impact Fundraising Grant 2025, which aims to build fundraising skills to power African solutions.
description: The Africa Impact Fundraising (AIF) Grant programme is a new initiative by the New Africa Fund, created to help African NGOs, community-based organisations, and social enterprises strengthen their fundraising capacity and access critical funding. Selected organisations will begin with an online training focused on small-donor campaigns, followed by a 30-day fundraising challenge. Top performers will receive up to US$5,000 in matching funds. Top-performing organisations will be invited to Kigali, Rwanda, for a week-long intensive training residency, which will dive deeper into all aspects of sustainable fundraising. Applications are open here until the end of today, July 31.

title: Hubs network AfriLabs signs collaboration agreement with Kenya’s Konza Technopolis
subtitle: AfriLabs, the largest pan-African network of innovation hubs, and Kenya’s Konza Technopolis Development Authority (KoTDA) have signed a strategic collaboration agreement to catalyse innovation, foster entrepreneurship, and promote inclusive technology development across Africa.
description: AfriLabsis a leading pan-African network of over 500 innovation and technology hubs across 53 African countries, while Konza Technopolis is a 5,000-acre, master-planned Kenyan smart city designed to drive economic growth through science, technology, innovation, and knowledge-based industries. The partnership will see the two institutions jointly design and implement a broad range of programmes and initiatives that support startups, build capacity, accelerate knowledge exchange, and unlock investment opportunities within and beyond Kenya. “This partnership represents our shared commitment to scaling African innovation through collaborative infrastructure, talent exchange, and knowledge networks. We’re proud to work alongside Konza Technopolis as we expand our mission to empower Africa’s next generation of innovators,” said Anna Ekeledo, executive director at AfriLabs.

title: Nigeria’s Thrivyx joins FasterCapital LaunchUp accelerator programme
subtitle: Nigeria’s Thrivyx, an API-first SaaS startup delivering integrated security, productivity, and file-sharing solutions, has joined FasterCapital’s LaunchUp programme.
description: Founded in 2021,Thrivyxis building a secure, cloud-native SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) platform for industrial and critical infrastructure systems. It provides real-time monitoring, control, and cybersecurity in a unified solution – designed for sectors like energy, utilities, manufacturing, and smart cities. Its platform integrates with legacy field equipment while enabling modern features like remote access, AI-powered anomaly detection, and digital twin visualisation. FasterCapital, meanwhile, is a global venture builder and online incubator dedicated to co-funding and co-founding innovative startups. Its LaunchUp programme is designed to help early-stage startups build scalable solutions with mentorship, strategic guidance, and network support. Thrivyx has now joined LaunchUp to accelerate its growth across Africa, Europe, and Asia by leveraging FasterCapital’s global network, capital resources, and industry expertise to address the urgent cybersecurity needs of mid-sized businesses in emerging markets. “The global cybersecurity and productivity SaaS market exceeds US$180 billion annually, driven by escalating cyber threats and the growing complexity of enterprise IT environments. However, many mid-sized companies – especially in regulated and tech-driven sectors such as fintech, healthtech, and logistics – struggle with fragmented, costly, and difficult-to-integrate security tools,” said Faster Capital. “This inefficiency creates significant operational risks and compliance challenges. Thrivyx targets this underserved segment by offering a unified, scalable platform that simplifies security monitoring, productivity analytics, and data management, filling a critical white space in the market.” Disrupt Africa reportedearlier this month Kenya’s Vumah Labs, a deep-tech innovation lab specialising in privacy-first AI, blockchain, and Zero-Knowledge Proof (ZKP) technologies, had also joined the LaunchUp programme.

meta_title: Thrivyx rejoint le programme d'accélération FasterCapital LaunchUp
Meta Description: La startup nigériane Thrivyx, spécialisée dans la cybersécurité SaaS, rejoint le programme LaunchUp de FasterCapital pour accélérer sa croissance en Afrique, Europe et Asie.
draft_summary:
- **Introduction:** Ce communiqué de presse annonce que Thrivyx, une startup nigériane spécialisée dans les solutions SaaS de sécurité, de productivité et de partage de fichiers, a rejoint le programme d'accélération LaunchUp de FasterCapital.

- **Thrivyx: Une Solution SaaS Intégrée:** Fondée en 2021, Thrivyx développe une plateforme SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition) sécurisée et native du cloud pour les systèmes industriels et les infrastructures critiques.  Sa solution unifiée offre une surveillance, un contrôle et une cybersécurité en temps réel pour les secteurs de l'énergie, des services publics, de la fabrication et des villes intelligentes.  Elle s'intègre aux équipements existants tout en proposant des fonctionnalités modernes comme l'accès à distance, la détection d'anomalies basée sur l'IA et la visualisation de jumeaux numériques.

- **FasterCapital et le Programme LaunchUp:** FasterCapital est un créateur d'entreprises et un incubateur en ligne qui cofinance et cofonde des startups innovantes.  Son programme LaunchUp aide les startups en phase initiale à développer des solutions évolutives grâce à du mentorat, des conseils stratégiques et un réseau de soutien.

- **Objectifs de Thrivyx:** En rejoignant LaunchUp, Thrivyx vise à accélérer sa croissance en Afrique, en Europe et en Asie en tirant parti du réseau mondial, des ressources financières et de l'expertise sectorielle de FasterCapital pour répondre aux besoins urgents en matière de cybersécurité des PME sur les marchés émergents.

- **Marché Ciblé:** Le marché mondial des logiciels SaaS de cybersécurité et de productivité dépasse 180 milliards de dollars par an.  De nombreuses PME, en particulier dans les secteurs réglementés et axés sur la technologie, rencontrent des difficultés avec des outils de sécurité fragmentés, coûteux et difficiles à intégrer. Thrivyx cible ce segment sous-desservi en offrant une plateforme unifiée et évolutive qui simplifie la surveillance de la sécurité, l'analyse de la productivité et la gestion des données.

- **Conclusion:** Le partenariat entre Thrivyx et FasterCapital souligne l'importance croissante de la cybersécurité pour les PME et le rôle des programmes d'accélération dans le soutien des startups innovantes.

title: 5 African ESOs secure backing from Village Capital’s $4m Ecosystem Catalysts Facility
subtitle: Five Entrepreneur Support Organisations (ESOs) have been named as venture partners for Village Capital’s Africa Ecosystem Catalysts Facility (AECF), a US$4 million initiative designed to invest in startups developing context-specific solutions that enhance economic mobility and climate resilience in Ghana, Nigeria, and Tanzania.
description: Run byVillage Capitalin collaboration with the Dutch Entrepreneurial Development Bank (FMO) and the Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO), the AECF aims to bridge funding gaps by investing appropriately-structured capital and aligning the investment process with the insights of ESOs who know their markets best. The AECF takes an ecosystem-embedded approach to investment by collaborating with locally-led ESOs to enable a more effective deployment of capital, anchored in deep local insight, to startups developing solutions that improve livelihoods, drive financial inclusion, and enhance resilience to climate change. By investing in high-impact startups and empowering ESOs as co-evaluators in the investment process, the AECF seeks to strengthen the broader entrepreneurial ecosystems in each country and accelerate the flow of appropriate, early-stage capital to where it’s needed most. Five ESOs have now been named as venture partners for the US$4 million initiative, namelyReach for Change(Ghana),Africa Fintech FoundryandFate Foundation(Nigeria), andAnzaEntrepreneurs andEnnovate Ventures(Tanzania). “No single investor can be an expert in every context – and that’s why this partnership matters,” said Nathaly Botero, innovations manager at Village Capital. “This model allows us to invest across markets while staying grounded in local realities. For us, this isn’t just about sourcing deals, it’s about making smarter, more informed investments by working alongside those already building and strengthening their entrepreneurial communities.”

Meta Description: Village Capital's $4M Africa Ecosystem Catalysts Facility invests in startups boosting economic mobility and climate resilience in Ghana, Nigeria, & Tanzania.
draft_summary:
- **Introduction:** Village Capital's Africa Ecosystem Catalysts Facility (AECF), a US$4 million initiative, has selected five Entrepreneur Support Organisations (ESOs) as venture partners.  The AECF aims to invest in startups developing solutions for economic mobility and climate resilience in Ghana, Nigeria, and Tanzania.

- **AECF Overview:**  The AECF is a collaboration between Village Capital, the Dutch Entrepreneurial Development Bank (FMO), and the Netherlands Enterprise Agency (RVO). It focuses on bridging funding gaps by providing appropriately-structured capital and leveraging the local market expertise of ESOs.

- **Investment Strategy:** The AECF employs an ecosystem-embedded approach, working with locally-led ESOs to ensure effective capital deployment.  This includes empowering ESOs as co-evaluators in the investment process, strengthening local entrepreneurial ecosystems, and accelerating the flow of early-stage capital.

- **Participating ESOs:** Five ESOs have been chosen as venture partners: Reach for Change (Ghana), Africa Fintech Foundry and Fate Foundation (Nigeria), and Anza Entrepreneurs and Ennovate Ventures (Tanzania).

- **Partnership Rationale:** The partnership emphasizes the importance of local expertise in investment decisions, ensuring investments are grounded in local realities.  The goal is to make more informed investments by working alongside those actively building entrepreneurial communities.

- **Conclusion:** The AECF represents a strategic initiative to support high-impact startups and strengthen entrepreneurial ecosystems across Ghana, Nigeria, and Tanzania by fostering collaborations between international investors and local ESOs.

title: Kenya’s Vumah Labs joins FasterCapital LaunchUp programme
subtitle: Kenya’s Vumah Labs, a deep-tech innovation lab specialising in privacy-first AI, blockchain, and Zero-Knowledge Proof (ZKP) technologies, has joined FasterCapital’s LaunchUp programme.
description: Founded in 2023 and rebranded in 2025, Vumah Labs is a Nairobi-based deeptech innovation lab dedicated to developing privacy-first AI, blockchain, and Zero-Knowledge Proof solutions. The company focuses on combating misinformation, securing legal and health data, and enhancing civic transparency across Africa. Vumah Labs combines cutting-edge technology with local insights to build ethical, scalable systems that restore trust in critical sectors. FasterCapital, meanwhile, is a global venture builder and online incubator dedicated to co-funding and co-founding innovative startups. Its LaunchUp programme is designed to help early-stage startups build scalable solutions with mentorship, strategic guidance, and network support. Vumah Labs has now joined LaunchUp to boost its mission to tackle misinformation, secure legal and health data, and enhance civic transparency across Africa by leveraging FasterCapital’s global reach, expertise, and capital-raising support. The company’s flagship products include Kweli, an AI-powered deepfake detection platform; ZK Consent & Research Gateway for privacy-compliant health research consent management; Digital Evidence Validator ensuring secure legal evidence chain-of-custody; and Civic ID & Record Hashing Tool for verifiable public record integrity. Through the LaunchUp programme, Vumah Labs gains access to FasterCapital’s extensive global network, technical mentorship, and capital-raising expertise. FasterCapital’s rigorous selection process ensures only high-potential startups join its portfolio, affirming Vumah Labs’ innovation and market fit. The partnership will accelerate MVP development, pilot deployments, and SaaS rollout, positioning Vumah Labs for rapid regional scale-up. FasterCapital’s strategic guidance and funding support are critical to unlocking Vumah Labs’ full potential as Africa’s leader in digital trust infrastructure. “Partnering with FasterCapital is a pivotal step in realising our vision of building scalable, ethical systems that protect privacy and secure critical data across Africa. Their expertise and network provide the perfect launchpad to accelerate our solutions from pilot to widespread adoption, ultimately restoring trust in vital sectors like health, legal, and civic institutions,” said Chepkemoi Chepkwony, CEO and founder of Vumah Labs.

title: Oracle Innovate Lab launched to support Eswatini entrepreneurs
subtitle: Thinkroom and The Oracle Group have partnered to launch the Oracle Innovate Lab, a founder-focused programme designed to support  early and growth-stage entrepreneurs in Eswatini in scaling their businesses and stepping into new markets.
description: Launching in August 2025, the six-month programme will combine one-on-one mentorship, hands-on masterclasses, and practical sessions to help founders build, pitch, and grow with purpose. The hybrid format allows for both online learning and in-person connection, creating a balance between access and accountability. “Founders in Eswatini are not short on innovation, grit, or drive. However, they need the support infrastructure around them to take that next big step. With Oracle Innovate Lab, we are creating a space where we can intentionally build growth in ten high-potential SMEs,” said Catherine Young, founder of Thinkroom. “This partnership with Oracle is an example of what it means to build meaningful growth with partners who want to make real impact. We are excited to kick off our first cohort with the Oracle Innovate Lab.” Applications are openhereuntil July 23.

The hybrid format allows for both online learning and in-person connection, creating a balance between access and accountability.“Founders in Eswatini are not short on innovation, grit, or drive. However, they need the support infrastructure around them to take that next big step. title: Applications open for MEST AI Startup Programme
subtitle: The Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology (MEST), a leader in tech entrepreneurship training and early-to-growth-stage startup support, has opened applications for its newly-evolved MEST AI Startup Programme.
description: MEST, a pan-African software and entrepreneurship training programme, seed fund, and incubator, has for the last 17 years trained and supported software entrepreneurs across the continent, contributing to Africa’s innovation economy. Now, as artificial intelligence transforms industries at a very rapid pace, MEST is positioning Africa’s tech entrepreneurs at the forefront of this shift. The redesign of its flagship programme is built to prepare Africa’s most promising tech talents to build, launch, and scale world-class AI startups. “Africa has world-class tech talent, and it’s time AI solutions built on the continent reach users everywhere,” said Emily Fiagbedzi, director of the MEST AI Startup Programme. “MEST is proud to contribute to this reality through our training and incubation programme that equips talent from across Africa with training and mentoring from international experts for the development of globally relevant AI software.” The MEST AI Startup Programme is a fully-funded, immersive experience hosted in Accra, Ghana, which equips Africa’s most promising AI entrepreneurs with the technical, business, and leadership skills to build and scale globally competitive startups. Over an intensive seven-month training phase, founders receive hands-on instruction, technical mentorship, and business coaching from global experts while developing AI-powered solutions to real-world challenges. The top ventures then advance to a four-month incubation period, where they refine their products, secure market traction, and sharpen their go-to-market strategies. At the end of incubation, startups have an opportunity to pitch for pre-seed investment of up to US$100, 000 and join the MEST portfolio. “Mastering AI and the advanced AI tools available today is a must for any entrepreneur and further levelling the playing field. The world has never been flatter. We are proud and excited to announce that the next batch of MEST entrepreneurs will be trained by some of the most knowledgeable people in the industry from companies such as OpenAI, Perplexity, Google, and Meltwater,” said MEST founder Jorn Lyseggen. For the 2026 intake, the programme is open to African founders based in West Africa aged 21 – 30 with software development experience who want to start their own AI startup. Applications are openhere.
